title: Fortnite is playing God with its in-game apocalypse – and its power over players is absolute
text:
What do Epic Games, the creator of Fortnite, and God, the alleged creator of reality, have in common? Naturally, both of them inspire deep devotion from millions of people. But as of this weekend, both have also destroyed a whole world in order to keep their followers loyal.

Epic's digital flood came at 7pm on Sunday, when every single logged-in player watched the game's famous island get sucked into a black hole. Then the game switched off entirely, leaving its 250m players with no way to get their fix.
